meanings.sent1: I can count to ten using my fingers, but I always get stuck at sixes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher wrote the number sixes on the board for the students to see.
meanings.sent3: At the bakery, they sold cookies shaped like little sixes, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The sixes on the clock seemed to mock me as I struggled to fall asleep.
meanings.sent5: In the game, the player needed to roll the dice and hope for sixes to win.

meanings.definition: A score of six runs in cricket.
meanings.sent1: The player hit the ball hard and scored sixes for the team.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered loudly as the batsman hit consecutive sixes.
meanings.sent3: The cricket match was so intense that every sixes scored felt like a victory.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the ball hitting the boundary for sixes echoed across the stadium.
meanings.sent5: Scoring sixes in cricket requires skill and precision from the players.

meanings.definition: A throw of six on a die.
meanings.sent1: When playing board games, I always hope for sixes on the dice.
meanings.sent2: The player rolled the die and celebrated when it landed on sixes.
meanings.sent3: In a game of chance, getting double sixes can bring both joy and frustration.
meanings.sent4: The odds of rolling sixes on a die are one in six, making it a rare occurrence.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of rolling sixes can turn a losing game into a thrilling victory.

meanings.definition: A group or set of six things.
meanings.sent1: The store offered a discount for buying sixes of the same item.
meanings.sent2: She arranged the flowers in sixes to create a beautiful centerpiece.
meanings.sent3: The children lined up in sixes for the school field trip, eager and excited.
meanings.sent4: The package contained sixes of colorful markers, perfect for the art project.
meanings.sent5: The team divided the tasks into sixes to work efficiently and quickly.
